title: Google officially releases paper claiming ‘quantum supremacy’
text:
It says Google has built a machine that can perform in 200 seconds a calculation that would take the world’s current most powerful supercomputer 10,000 years. The claim initially appeared on NASA’s website last month, but was deleted shortly after posting. IBM challenged the claim then, and renewed its criticism this week, offering an official rebuttal arguing that a classical computer can actually perform the task in as little as 2.5 days. (The Logic)

Talking point: Quantum supremacy is when a quantum machine performs a task that exceeds the capacity of a traditional computer. If real, this is a major milestone—perhaps one reason IBM is so keen to debunk the claim. The two firms are among a host of big players currently researching quantum computing, with Microsoft, Accenture and Baidu also among them. IBM’s initial complaint was that the task was too narrow and devoid of practical use to usher in a new era of computing. Now, it’s arguing the calculation is actually well within the capabilities of a traditional computer. Google hasn’t yet responded to Big Blue’s critique.
